Copying Saved Reports

Copying a report is simple in BIQ. When you click on a saved report, you will see the available options to see DETAILS, EDIT, COPY, and so on. Clicking COPY will prompt you to specify a name for the facsimile of the original report that you are creating. Once you click OK, the new report will be created and will show up as a new report in your saved reports catalog.

Copying is often useful for when you want to be able to modify a report that someone has shared with you. When you create a copy, you are simply copying that report definition into a new saved report. There is no “link” to the original, so you have full edit rights over a report copy that you create.
